definitions.definition: Something designed to fool , dupe , outsmart , mislead or swindle .
examples: It was just a trick to say that the house was underpriced.
He played a trick on his sister as April Fool's Day.

definitions.definition: A single element of a magician 's (or any variety entertainer's) act; a magic trick .
examples: And for my next trick , I will pull a wombat out of a duffel bag.
That's a nice skateboard, but can you do any tricks on it?

definitions.definition: An effective , clever or quick way of doing something.
examples: tricks of the trade;  what's the trick of getting this chair to fold up?

definitions.definition: Mischievous or annoying behavior; a prank .
examples: They played a crude trick on the teacher.

definitions.definition: A particular habit or manner ; a peculiarity ; a trait .
examples: a trick of drumming with the fingers; a trick of frowning

definitions.definition: A knot , braid , or plait of hair.
A sequence in which each player plays a card and a winning play is determined.
examples: I was able to take the second trick with the queen of hearts.

definitions.definition: A sex act , chiefly one performed for payment ; an act of prostitution .
A customer or client of a prostitute .
examples: As the businessman rounded the corner, she thought, "Here comes another trick ."

definitions.definition: A daily period of work , especially in shift -based jobs .
A sailor's spell of work at the helm , usually two hours long.
A toy ; a trifle ; a plaything .
A representation of arms that is drawn as an outline with labels to indicate colors.

main_definition: Something designed to fool , dupe , outsmart , mislead or swindle .
secondary_definitions: A single element of a magician 's (or any variety entertainer's) act; a magic trick .
An effective , clever or quick way of doing something.
Mischievous or annoying behavior; a prank .
( dated ) A particular habit or manner ; a peculiarity ; a trait .
A knot , braid , or plait of hair.
( card games ) A sequence in which each player plays a card and a winning play is determined.
( slang ) A sex act , chiefly one performed for payment ; an act of prostitution .
( slang ) A customer or client of a prostitute .
( slang , vulgar ) A term of abuse.
( Western Pennsylvania ) A daily period of work , especially in shift -based jobs .
( nautical ) A sailor's spell of work at the helm , usually two hours long.
( obsolete ) A toy ; a trifle ; a plaything .
( heraldry ) A representation of arms that is drawn as an outline with labels to indicate colors.
